Submodules

lions.errors module

Module Name: errors.py Author: Diogo Ferreira (ItsNotSoftware) Date: May 8, 2024

Description:

This module contains the custom exceptions used by the LIONS compiler. This exceptions are used for error messages in case of invalid message files.

License:

Copyright (c) 2024 Diogo Ferreira. All rights reserved. This code is licensed under the MIT License.

exception lions.errors.DuplicateIdError(name, id, sugested_id)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when a message ID is duplicated.

exception lions.errors.DuplicateMsgNameError(name)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when a message name is duplicated.

exception lions.errors.InvalidTypeError(msg_name, field_name, type)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when a field has an invalid type.

exception lions.errors.InvalidTypeSizeError(msg_name, field_name, type, size)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when a field has an invalid size for its type.

exception lions.errors.MissingFieldError(field, message_name)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when a required field is missing.

exception lions.errors.MsgFilesNotFoundError(dir)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when the message file is not found.

exception lions.errors.OutOfBoundsIdError(msg_name, id)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when a message ID is out of bounds.

exception lions.errors.PayloadOverflowError(msg_name, size)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when the payload size exceeds the maximum size.

lions.lmsg module

Module Name: lmsg.py Author: Diogo Ferreira (ItsNotSoftware) Date: May 8, 2024

Description:

This module contains the python representation of YAML parsed messages.

License:

Copyright (c) 2024 Diogo Ferreira. All rights reserved. This code is licensed under the MIT License.

class lions.lmsg.LMsg(*, name: str, id: int, period: int, fields: list[MsgField])

Bases: BaseModel

Python representation of a LMsg (defined in YAML)

Attributes:

name (str): Name of the message id (int): ID of the message period (int): Period of the message (used to generate a constant for shceduling) fields (list[MsgField]): List of fields in the message

Methods:

validate_id(self): Validate the ID of the LMsg validate_name(cls, v: str) -> str: Validate the name of the LMsg validate_payload_size(cls, fields: list[MsgField]) -> list[MsgField]: Validate the payload size of the LMsg payload_size(self) -> int: Get the payload size of the LMsg

fields: list[MsgField]
id: int
model_computed_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'fields': FieldInfo(annotation=list[MsgField], required=True), 'id': FieldInfo(annotation=int, required=True), 'name': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'period': FieldInfo(annotation=int, required=True)}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

name: str
property payload_size: int

Get the payload size of the LMsg

period: int
validate_id() → LMsg

Validate the ID of the LMsg

Raises:

DuplicateIdError: If the ID is already in use OutOfBoundsIdError: If the ID is out of bounds

Returns:

LMsg: The current instance of the LMsg

classmethod validate_name(v: str) → str

Validate the name of the LMsg

Note:

! This method does nothing because of the way the yaml module works. Duplicate names mean a previously defined message with the same name is overwritten.

Args:

cls (LMsg): LMsg class v (str): string containing the name

Raises:

DuplicateMsgNameError: If the name is already in use

Returns:

str: string containing the name

validate_payload_size() → LMsg

Validate the payload size of the LMsg

Raises:

PayloadOverflowError: If the payload size is greater than 248 bytes

Returns:

LMsg: The current instance of the LMsg

class lions.lmsg.MsgField(*, parent_msg_name: str, name: str, type: str, size: int, start: int = 0)

Bases: BaseModel

Python representation of a message field in a LMsg

Attributes:

parent_msg_name (str): Name of the parent LMsg (used for error messages) name (str): Name of the field type (str): Type of the field size (int): Size of the field start (int): Start position of the field inside the payload array

Methods:

validate_size(cls, v: int) -> int: Validate the size of the field based on the type validate_type(self) -> MsgField: Validate the type of the field

model_computed_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'name': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'parent_msg_name': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'size': FieldInfo(annotation=int, required=True), 'start': FieldInfo(annotation=int, required=False, default=0), 'type': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True)}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

name: str
parent_msg_name: str
size: int
start: int
type: str
classmethod validate_size(v: int) → int

Validate if the size of the field is valid

Args:

cls (MsgField): MsgField class v (int): size of the field

Raises:

ValueError: If the size is not between 0 and 248 bytes

Returns:

int: size of the field

validate_type() → MsgField

Validate the type specified by the user is valid

Raises:

InvalidTypeError: If the type is not valid

Returns:

MsgField: The current instance of the MsgField

lions.main module

Module Name: main.py Author: Diogo Ferreira (ItsNotSoftware) Date: May 8, 2024

Description:

This module is the main entry point for the LIONS compiler. It is responsible for parsing the command line arguments, reading the message files, and generating the corresponding C++ message files.

License:

Copyright (c) 2024 Diogo Ferreira. All rights reserved. This code is licensed under the MIT License.

lions.main.main()
lions.main.print_success_message()

Function to print success message after all messages are compiled

lions.main.print_title()

Function to print title of the program in ASCII art

lions.yaml_parser module

Module Name: yaml_parser.py Author: Diogo Ferreira (ItsNotSoftware) Date: May 8, 2024

Description:

This module contains the YAML parser class for parsing lmsg.yaml files into python objects.

License:

Copyright (c) 2024 Diogo Ferreira. All rights reserved. This code is licensed under the MIT License.

class lions.yaml_parser.YamlParser(msg_files_dir: str)

Bases: object

Class to parse lmsg.yaml files into python objects

Attributes:

file_data (dict[str, dict]): Dictionary containing the filename and the data for each file

Methods:

validate_type_size(msg_name: str, field_name, type: str, size: int): Validate the size of the field based on the type get_file_data(msg_files_dir: str) -> dict[str, dict]: Load the lmsg.yaml files from the directory msg_files_directory yamlMsg_to_LMsg(msg_name: str, msg_data: dict) -> LMsg: Convert a YAML message to a LMsg object parse_file() -> Generator[tuple[str, list[LMsg]], None, None]: Parse the lmsg.yaml files and yields information about one file at a time

static get_file_data(msg_files_dir: str) → dict[str, dict]

Load the lmsg.yaml files from the directory msg_files_directory

Args:

msg_files_dir (str): Directory containing the lmsg.yaml files

Raises:

MsgFilesNotFoundError: If no lmsg.yaml files are found in the directory

Returns:

dict[str, dict]: Dictionary containing the filename and the data for each file

parse_file() → Generator[tuple[str, list[LMsg]], None, None]

Parse the lmsg.yaml files and yields information about one file at a time

Yields:

tuple[str, list[LMsg]]: Tuple containing the filename and the LMsg object for each file

static validate_type_size(msg_name: str, field_name, type: str, size: int)

Validate the size of the field based on the type

Args:

msg_name (str): Name of the message field_name (str): Name of the field type (str): Type of the field size (int): Size of the field

Raises:

InvalidTypeSizeError: If the size is invalid for the given type

static yamlMsg_to_LMsg(msg_name: str, msg_data: dict) → LMsg

Convert a YAML message to a LMsg object

Args:

msg_name (str): Name of the message msg_data (dict): Dictionary containing the message data

Raises:

ValueError: If a required key is missing in the message data

Returns:

LMsg: LMsg object
